ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course does a great job of laying the foundations for reading, writing, and speaking Persian. The professor was very willing to answer questions and did a great job of providing feedback on our work.

Yes! Depending on your reasons for learning the language. It is definitely not an easy class, but you learn extremely quickly and Prof. Shayesteh is great. I repeat, it is a lot of work, especially L2, but well worth it.
I would recommend this class to anyone interested in learning Persian.
If you're serious about learning Persian, then take it. Just do so recognizing in advance that you have to log the hours and stay on top of your workload to get a decent grade.
